eventFormat:
The following electronic equipments will be provided at the venue:

  • Arduino Uno, with cable

  • ESP 8266 e01 Wi-Fi module

  • Single strand wires

  • Breadboard

The participants will also be provided with water, food, power points, stationery and Wi-Fi.


Registration Fee: ₹250 per Head

The shortlisted participants should pay the above registration fee on the day of the event.


Timeline

Registations close on: Wednesday, 20th September

IoT class by GES Infotek: Saturday, 23rd September

Problem Statements release: Monday, 25th September

Shortlisting- Phone interview: Thursday, 28th September

Event: Sunday - Monday, 1st and 2nd October


The IoT class on 23rd September is compulsory for all the registered participants.

Class venue: Govt. Model Engineering College, Thrikkakkara

Timings: 10:00am to 1:00pm

Reporting time: 9:30am
rules:
Rules

  1. The team size should not exceed 3 members.

  2. Cross - college teams are allowed.

  3. The project must be built from scratch.

  4. Pre-programmed devices are not permitted.

  5. The participants are not allowed to leave the venue until the event is concluded.

  6. The contestants are expected to bring project specific components (sensors, actuators, jumpers etc), tools (soldering iron, wire strippers etc) and laptops.

  7. The evaluation will be based on the degree of completion, technical complexity and innovativeness of the project.

  8. Inappropriate conduct of the team will result in immediate disqualification.

  9. The components provided by the organizers should be returned undamaged upon event conclusion. Damage to provided components and properties must be reimbursed.

  10. The decision made by the judges shall be final.

  11. The shortlisted participants must be present at the venue by 9:00am on the day of the event.
shortDes: What if your smartphone could talk to the microwave oven? And your car to the air conditioner? When life gets tangled in a cobweb of schedules, make sure you find your way out
contact_details:

Contacts

description:
Techathon

What if your smartphone could talk to the microwave oven? And your car to the air conditioner? When life gets tangled in a cobweb of schedules, make sure you find your way out. Create your own technological ecosystem in the world of Internet of Things. So pull up your sleeves and get coding! It's time to break through barriers and challenges using your technical skills. Get ready for Techathon, a 24 hour IOT hackathon. Are you ready to get connected?

Venue: Kerala startup mission, Kalamassery

Date: Oct 1st and 2nd
name: Techathon

eventFormat:
IEEE members getting shortlisted for the event will have a discount of 20% from their excel registration fee.


This event is mainly spread over two categories namely Technical and Non Technical.Technical presentations serve engineering, scientific and high tech purposes, describing advances in technology, problem resolution, product design and project status. In Technical category, the paper/innovative ideas comes under the following field of study:

1. Electronics and Communication

2. Electronics and Biomedical

3. Electrical and Electronics

4. Computer Science

Non - Technical papers are associated with general developments in the world including any new concept or idea developed by the team. Papers can be from the areas:

  1. Wastewater Treatment and Water Supply Systems

  2. Digitization

  3. Developmentally Delayed Issues for Youth in Foster Care

  4. Tuberculosis in India: The Curse of the Increasing Inequality

  5. Urbanization - A Blessing In Disguise


Phase 1:

An abstract giving complete details of the paper in not more than 600 words is to be sent to poa@excelmec.org from 1/09/2017, on or before 20/09/2017.

Phase 2:

The teams that are shortlisted after thorough examination of the abstracts will be notified via email .

The teams must prepare a power-point presentation in MS PowerPoint in the format given here.

The teams must prepare a final paper in the IEEE format. The IEEE paper format can be downloaded here.

The final presentation will be conducted at Excel 2017. Total time allotted for presentation is 15 minutes of which, 10 minutes is for

presentation.



The following facilities are provided at Excel 2017:

1. LCD Projector

2. Microphone

3. Laptop/Computer
rules:
Team Formation:

1. A team can have a maximum of 3 members

2. A participant cannot be part of more than one team .

3. It is not necessary that the participants forming a team should be from the

same college

4. There is no restriction in the number of teams from the same college .

General:

1. The work should be original and in the specified format.

2. Students pursuing their graduation and post graduation can participate

irrespective of their field of study.

3. A team cannot send in more than 2 abstracts.

4. 20% of the total marks will be allotted for format of Report and the rest is for Presentation style as well as the Question and Answer session.

5. The coordinators reserve the right of rejecting any paper following deviation of the paper from the format specified.

description:
“The vision must be followed by the venture,it is not enough to stare up the steps - we must step up the stairs”.


Papyrus of Ani is a technical paper presentation competition - a platform to bring to light exciting technical ideas that may well be the next big thing in the field. If you have an idea worth spreading, we will provide you the apt audience to hear your thoughts. Present your idea and earn the respect of your peers and experts in the field.


Date: 5th October, Thursday

name: Papyrus of Ani

shortDes: A million things can happen in a moment. From myriad emotions to familiar scents, places and it's people to memories and journeys, a moment is never enough. Photography is the art of weaving a million stories from a single moment
eventFormat:
First Phase – Online Contest

Second Phase – Instant Photography


Online Contest

An online photography contest spanning 4 weeks, wherein participants will need to submit photographs related to the theme provided for that particular time period. Each week will have a different theme, which will be updated on the official Facebook page, for which the participants can submit a maximum of 3 photographs. Entries must be mailed to the e-mail address provided above. The participant can participate in all of the four sessions.

All the images received will be uploaded on Excel's Facebook page in an album titled 'Third Eye - Online Photography Entries' with the caption submitted by the participant along with the ID no. provided to each participant. The photos will also be uploaded on Instagram, with the hashtags provided along with the entry.


Theme 1 – Reflections

Deadline – 11th September

Theme 2 – Innocence

Deadline – 19th September

Theme 3 – Coming Soon


Instant Photography Round:

Participants will be given a theme onsite and will be asked to take photographs based on this given theme. Participants can submit at most 3 photographs based on the particular theme. Photographs are awarded marks based on the content, originality and relevance to the theme. There will be 2 sessions without elimination and a final session for the top 5 contenders on leader-board.


Judging Criteria:

'Judge's Choice' winner will be selected by a panel of appointed judges. The winner will be decided purely based on thought process behind the photo, the quality and creativity exhibited by the photographer.

'People's Choice' winner will be decided on the basis of the popularity of the photo. 'People's Choice' winner will be valued as per the scoring system given below -

Facebook likes – 1 point

Instagram likes – 2 points

The winners will be announced on the Excelmec Facebook Page.
rules:
ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA: Must be an undergraduate student studying in India.

The entries must comply with the following requirements

  1. Photography, using all types of cameras (DSLR, SLR, Mobile cameras) is permitted. The type of camera must be mentioned along with each entry.

  2. All entries must be submitted in digital format via e-mail. Mails must be sent to thirdeye@excelmec.org.

  3. All entries must contain a short description of the photo, the name of the participant, name of the college/organization/school, phone number and, if possible, the exif details of the photo.

  4. All photographs must be in JPEG or JPG format.

  5. Each entrant may submit at most 3 photographs for a theme with respective descriptions. Each photo must be less than 3MB in size.

  6. Post processing of any kind is explicitly forbidden and is a criterion for disqualification.

  7. Watermarks of any kind are NOT allowed. Submitted pictures will be watermarked by the event organisers so as to prevent the misuse of the submitted picture.

  8. Submission of plagiarised photos or show of popularity using unfair means will result in the photo being disqualified for the category of People's choice.

  9. Presence of any sort of vulgarism, racism or provocation as well as copied entries, if found with valid proof, will be disqualified and deleted from the album immediately.

  10. By submitting an entry, each entrant agrees to the official rules and warrants that the entry complies with all the guidelines in the official rules.

  11. This is skill-based contest and it plays an important part in the determination of winners.

  12. Rules are subject to change at any point in time.


RELEASE

  • The winning photograph will be released on Excel 2017 Facebook page, at the end of the event.

  • Upon winning, the participant should submit College ID proof along with the original photograph.

  • Odds of winning depend upon the number of eligible entries received and the skill displayed by the entrant.

LICENSE

All entries retain the copyright to their photograph, for the duration of copyright, and may use each photograph and description for advertising, marketing and promotional purpose to any and all media now known or hereafter created.
description:
A million things can happen in a moment. From myriad emotions to familiar scents, places and it's people to memories and journeys, a moment is never enough. Photography is the art of weaving a million stories from a single moment. It's never just about what is seen, it's always about how it is seen and experienced. For those who believe that immortality is just a click away, Excel 2017 brings you 'The Third Eye Photography Contest' in the memory of Vineeth Marar.


Become a storyteller, capture defining moments and share your experience through images. Ignite passions, initiate thought and inspire action through the power of the lens.
name: Third Eye Photography

eventFormat:
The event is not a simultaneous race, and will be a time based obstacle race.


Round 1(Qualifiers):

The Teams will have to face a qualifier round if the number of teams participating exceed 15. It will be a short round with a single obstacle. The first 15 teams(based on the time taken to complete the course) will qualify to the next round.


Round 2:

Round 2 will consist of a circular course with simple obstacles. This round will test the speed and agility of the drone. This round will be timed.


Round 3:

Round two will consist of an obstacle course with challenges of increasing difficulty.

Each obstacle will have points based on their difficulty.


The final result will be based on the total points earned in round 2 and 3.


The arena will be revealed only before the commencement of the event.


Robot Specifications:

  • Drone dimensions should not exceed 50x50x20 cm and should not be less than 15x15x20.

  • NO restriction in rating of motors used or frame material.

  • Drone should be capable of a minimum flight time of 5 minutes.

  • FPV drones are allowed.
rules:
• It is not mandatory for all the members of a team to be from the same educational institution.

  • A team can have a maximum of up to 4 members.

  • Members of a team showing disrespect to the rules or to the other competitors, shall cause immediate disqualification of his/her team.

  • The drones should not be tested/flown over a height of 10m.

  • Drones are to be built within given specifications.

  • Winners will be decided based on the final score which will be based on the performance of the drone in both round 1 and 2.

  • 240v power plugs will be provided at the venue for charging.

  • A team can use only one drone throughout the event. (only the mechanical parts can be changed in case of damage)

  • Repairs/part replacement/calibrations shall only be done at specified checkpoints.

  • Ready-made kits will be disqualified.

  • The team will be disqualified immediately if any of the drones are found to be unsafe for the audience.

  • Decision of the judges will be final and binding.

  • Rules are subject to change at any point in time. All rules will be explained at the event as well.
shortDes: When you play the Game of Drones, you either fly or you fall
contact_details:

    +91-9495981767
description:
When you play the Game of Drones, you either fly or you fall. There's no middle ground.Do you daydream of flying drones and gunning for glory? If your ideas can fly as high as your drones, we have just the right venue for you.Excel 2017 presents The Game Of Drones - an event exclusively for drones. Show off your skills in robotics and earn the title of the Top Gun.

Registration fee: Rs. 800/- per team

Registration closes on: 25/09/2017

Venue: Govt. Model Engineering College, Thrikkakkara

Date: 05/10/2017
name: Game of Drones

eventFormat:
Round 1:

Preliminary round

Robots will be divided into two groups. Each robot will have to face every member of its own group and the top four will move to the semi-finals.

Points are awarded based on the following fields - speed, skill, controlling ability and strength.

Match Duration - 5 minutes.

Point Distribution:

  • Distribution of bonus points will only be announced one hour prior to the event.

  • Knocking the opponent off the arena-20 point

  • Immobilizing it for 10 seconds - 10 point


Round 2:

The Semi-finals

  • The arena will have undergone some changes.

  • One-on-One Knockout.

  • There will be two semi-finals.

  • The winners of the two semi-finals will qualify to the Grand Finale.

  • Time limit of this round will be 10 minutes.

Point Distribution:

Knockout – 20 point.

Immobilising the opponent for 15 seconds – 10 point.


Round 3: Final

The Grand finale

One-on-one knockout round.

10 minute battle.

The bot with the maximum points wins.

Point Distribution:

Knockout – 20 point.

Immobilizing the opponent for 10 seconds – 10 point.


Robot Specifications:

Maximum permitted dimensions of the robot are 45 cm X 45cm X 45 cm and its weight must not exceed 25 kg. 10% tolerance in weight and dimensions are allowed.

Each robot must have its own power supply not exceeding 24V.
rules:
1. Each team can have up to four members.
  2. Every participant must have their college ID card/Excel participation ID.
  3. Registrations close at 10.00 am of the day of event.
  4. It is not mandatory for all the members of a team to be from the same institution.
  5. The Robot must be manually controlled through wired/wireless interface.
  6. Maximum permitted dimensions of the robot are 45 cm X 45 cm X 45 cm and its weight must not exceed 25 kg. 10% tolerance in weight and dimensions are allowed.
  7. Each robot must have its own power supply not exceeding 24V. However a power point(230V AC) will be provided for recharging batteries or to power your supply.
  8. Bots can have any forms of weapons (other than fire, sharp objects and projectiles), if any bot is found unsafe for the audience, it'll be not allowed to participate in the event.
  9. All teams will have to have their bots inspected by the coordinators both before and after each stage.
  10. Teams are permitted to make minor changes to the body of their robot after every stage if they wish; but modifying the entire body of the robot will not be permitted.
  11. Arena will be disclosed only at the time of the event.
  12. Only two members from each team are allowed to operate the bot during each stage.
  13. Both members are allowed to control the bot staying behind the board. So the wire must be of sufficient length in order to cover the entire arena.
  14. Any team/team member found disrespecting the rules/other competitors, will be disqualified.
  15. Bonus points will be announced one hour prior to the event.
  16. Coordinators can change the event format at any time during the event.
  17. The decision of the judges will be final and binding.
  18. Cross-college teams are allowed.
  19. Malpractices and sabotaging other teams' machines will lead to immediate disqualification.
  20. Organizers reserve the right to make decisions in case of conflicts and other issues.

description:
Are you game for a round of sheer grit and guts? Do you have what it takes to battle it out for the ultimate glory? Prepare yourself for a no-holds-barred, nerve wrecking metal against metal carnage. So grab your bots and get ready to rumble! Only the worthy shall be left standing when the dust settles.

Venue: Govt. Model Engineering College, Thrikkakkara

Date: 06/10/2017
name: Robowar

shortDes: It ain't man-to-man. It'll be bot-to-bot. The robots go rolling the ball this time. Build your bot, and get them on their way to the golden boot!
eventFormat:
Round 1:

PRELIMINARY ROUND

  1. Teams will be divided into two groups.
  2. Each team will have to face one other teams of its own group based on random selection and the top two will be move to semi-finals.
  3. The positions will be determined by the points scored by each team.
  4. There won't be any tie breaker during prelims.


POINT DISTRIBUTION: 1 goal – 1 point.

MATCH DURATION: 6 minutes. Break of 30 seconds after 3 mins match.


Round 2:

THE SEMI-FINALS

  1. The team with maximum number of goals in the match wins.
  2. In case of tie, it will be sudden death.
  3. The winners of semi-finals will qualify to Grand Finale.


MATCH DURATION: 8 minutes. Break of 1 minute after 4 minutes of match.


Loser's final:

  1. The team with maximum number of goals in match wins.
  2. In case of tie. It will be sudden death.
  3. The winner gets the 3rd prize.

MATCH DURATION: 8 minutes. Break of 1 minute after 5 minute of match.


Round 4:

THE GRAND FINALE

  1. The team with maximum number of goals in match wins.
  2. In case of tie. It will be a sudden death.
  3. The winner gets 1st price. Loser 2nd

MATCH DURATION: 10 minutes. Break of 1 minute after 5 minute match.


NOTE: POINTS ARE NOT CARRIED TO NEXT LEVEL. Higher points at the end of round do not guarantee any leverage in the next rounds.


Robot Specifications:

  1. The dimension of the bot should not exceed 30cm length, 20cm height and 30cm height.
  2. The maximum weight of the bot should not exceed 5kgs.
  3. The bot must be manually controlled through wired/wireless interface.
  4. The length of wire (if wired) should be enough for the bot to travel throughout the stage. The wire should not be in the way of ball or opponent.
  5. Actuators that may help in the motion of the bot are allowed.
  6. Users of readymade bots are not allowed.
  7. Each of bot must have its own power supply not exceeding 12V.
  8. Trap for ball should not be in any other shape then rectangle with front side open. The breadth should be less than 5cm. This by whole should fit under the dimensional constrains.
rules:
1. One team can have a maximum of 4 members and all members may not be same college.
  2. Every participant must have their college ID card/ Excel participation ID.
  3. Each team can only use one bot for the match.
  4. The team which manages to score the maximum number of goals win. In case of draw. it will be sudden death.
  5. The controller should stay behind his/her goal post.
  6. The bots will be placed at opposite corners of the stage before start of each session.
  7. The match shall be paused if bots are unable to move or if anything goes wrong. Under the direction of the judges. The reset position will be determined by the same.
  8. All teams will have to have their bots inspected by the coordinators before the commencement of the match.
  9. Coordinators can change the event format at any time during the event.
  10. Decision of the judge shall be final.


BONUS

Wireless bot will be given an advantage of 1 extra goal in case of a tie.

eventFormat:
• From the incoming entries, 20 films will shortlisted by a panel.
  • The top 20 films will be played on the day of the event in front of the esteemed filmmakers who will be selecting the winners.
  • Along with the screening, there will be an interactive session where the makers can talk to the audience about their film and their journey as a team.
  • Certificates and gift vouchers will be also given for Best Actor, Best Actress, Best Director, Best story,Best cinematographer and Best Editor.
  • Online certificates will be awarded to all the shortlisted entries.
rules:
• It is an open event. Entries are invited from all.
  • The entries have to be original. Content copied from any external source can lead to direct disqualification.
  • Only films shot/released after October 2016 are eligible for entry.
  • Entry fee is Rs 250 per team which can be send through Paytm (9633554696) or can be sent along with the DVD.
  • The film cannot exceed a total time of 25 mins (Including title card and credits).
  • Entries can be in any language but suitable subtitles must be furnished for languages other than Malayalam.
  • There is no subject/theme for the competition.
  • Entries previously published online may share respective Youtube links. All other entries must be submitted in a single DVD(DVD-R,DVD+R,DVD-R DL,DVD+RDL), encoded in industry standard video format viz.AVI,VOB,MP4,MKV,WMV,MOV or MPEG.
  • The entries must be sent along with a filled up registration form and a copy of the ID proof of one of the crew members (preferably director, cinematographer or an actor).
  • Last date for sending entries is September 30th 2017.
  • If the film has already been released, a YouTube link of the video should be send to the coordinators of the event.
  • Entries may also be mailed via post to

Ananth Krishnan

Sree, JRA 05, Jayanagar

Maradu P.O

Ernakulam

shortDes: An inventive event that recognizes that creativity is the genius of the mind. An electro-mechanical DIY,this event is all about ideation and creation. Problems to test the basics of your electrical and mechanical proficiency will require you to build a gadget using the components provided and a time constraint.
name: Ultimate Engineer
description:
Scientists dream about doing great things. Engineers do them.

﻿

Combining smart and art is a tough job, but if you're ready to test your grit, skill and knowledge, you're at the right place.

Can you beat the clock to build the gadget you envisioned?

They say, creativity is the genius of the mind. And what could be more creative than a little bit of Engineering?

Do you have what it takes to be the Ultimate Engineer?
rules:
1. Participants can use their laptops during the entire duration of the event.
  2. Decision of the judges will be final and binding.
  3. Shortlisted participants will have to report to the venue by 9:00 at the day of the event.
  4. Excel team reserves the right to take final decisions in case of any dispute.
  5. Excel team is not responsible for any loss of property, injury and delays caused by the participants during the event.
  6. Contestants should present their college ID cards.
  7. Excel ID is mandatory.
  8. Knowledge in proteus, AutoCad etc will be an advantage.
  9. Cross-college teams are allowed.
  10. Malpractices and sabotaging other teams' machines will lead to immediate disqualification.
  11. Judges' decision will be final.
  12. Organizers reserve the right to make decisions in case of conflicts and other issues.
eventFormat:
Round 1 (Online Prelims):

The participants will have to answer 18 MCQ questions in 20 mins and 2 descriptive questions in another 20 mins.

The questions will be based on basic electrical, electronics, mechanical and computer science concepts.

Top 18 participants will be shortlisted.


Round 2:

Group discussion

The individual participants will be partnered up in teams of 3 on the day of the event and they will have to attend a group discussion.

The rules and the topic for discussion will be announced before the session commences


Round 3:

Design

The teams will be given a problem statement, and will have to come up with a solution along with a design using the given software tools like proteus and Autocad.

The participants may use softwares other than the ones provided and can bring their own laptops for this round.


Round 4:

Presentation

The participants will have to present their design in front of a judging panel at the end of the design round.

shortDes: ALOHOMORA! The magic words have been said. The doors have opened. It's;s time to hunt for the treasure. The most participated non-tech event in Excel which saw more than 350 teams participating last year and a tremendous success.
name: ALOHOMORA-The hunt begins
description: ALOHOMORA! The magic words have been said. The doors have opened. It's;s time to hunt for the treasure. The most participated non-tech event in Excel which saw more than 350 teams participating last year and a tremendous success. This year, its back with greater energy and vigour. Covering a much bigger area and scheduled for two days, its bigger and much more fascinating. So get ready to set your grey cells to work and get your adrenaline levels soaring.
rules:
Rules

  • Each team must comprise of 4 members.
  • The participants must carry their valid id cards at each round of the game.
  • Teams clearing the 1st round should report at the place announced before the time deadline. Failing to report at the specified time will be considered a disqualification.
  • Picking up fights with other teams or the authority will lead to disqualification of the team.
  • Since the event is scheduled for two days the participants clearing the first day must look after the arrangements for their accomodation on their own.
  • Each round has its own set of rules and participants are strictly adviced to stick to those rules and instructions.
  • Any malpractice during the event will lead to disqualification of the team.
  • The decision of the authority on any matter will be final.
eventFormat:
Event format



Peliminary


The preliminary round is in theform of a paper test conducted inside the college.


Consecutive rounds


The rest of Alohomora will comprise a compete treasure hunt conducted in various rounds and a vast span of area in and around college.

These rounds conducted in a span of two days will comprise of eliminations and the successful team moves on to the next round.

A team has to survive through all these rounds till the end to find the Treasure.

name: Extrinsicity
description: Love messing around and playing with circuits, bugs and all things electronics? Look no further, Extrinsicity is your cup of tea mate! Wind your way through intriguing analogue circuits and calculated signals to win the great war of circuitry and prove your devotion to electronics.
shortDes: Love messing around and playing with circuits, bugs and all things electronics? Look no further, Extrinsicity is your cup of tea mate!
rules:
1. This will be a team event with each team having not more than three members.
  2. All members of the team need not be from the same college.
  3. All members are expected to exhibit their college ID and Excel ID cards.
  4. All items required for the event will be provided by the coordinators.
  5. Use of mobile phone is strictly prohibited.
  6. Decision of coordinators will be final.
  7. Excel team will not bear responsibility for any loss of property, injury or delay caused by participants during the event.
  8. Teams violating the above rules will be suspended immediately.
  9. Cross-college teams are allowed.
  10. Malpractices and sabotaging other teams' machines will lead to immediate disqualification.
  11. Judges' decision will be final.
  12. Organizers reserve the right to make decisions in case of conflicts and other issues.
  13. Rules are subject to change at any point in time. All rules will be explained at the event as well
eventFormat:
Round 1 (Prelims):

Participants will have to answer a set of questions based on Analog electronic circuits and signals. Top 8 teams will qualify for the next round.


Round 2:

Rapid Fire

The shortlisted teams will be given a set of design questions consecutively The first 6 teams to answer all the questions will advance to the next round.


Round 3:

Debugging

The shortlisted teams will be given a circuit which they'll have to identify, debug and redesign. The first 4 teams to complete the task will advance to the next round.


Round 4:

Wave cloning

The final round will test how good you are with the CRO. A sample pattern will be given on the CRO. The team which will replicate the given pattern first will be declared the winner.

name: Defuse 101
shortDes: Have you ever wondered how bombs are defused? How would it feel to stand there,right at the edge -dancing with danger? What if each passing second is ticking away on the dial of a live bomb.
description:
Have you ever wondered how bombs are defused? How would it feel to stand there,right at the edge -dancing with danger? What if each passing second is ticking away on the dial of a live bomb.

Battle against time to disarm a live ticking bomb. Decipher the secrets of binary and digital electronics to crack the code.Step up and be the hero!
rules:

  4. No competitive aids must be brought to college. Calculators are prohibited.
  5. Use of mobile phone is prohibited during the event.

  8. In case of no output from any team or tie, judgement shall be made based on a viva-voce by the judges.
  9. Decision of the judges shall be final.
  10. Rules are subject to change at any time.
  11. Cross-college teams are allowed.
  12. Malpractices and sabotaging other teams' machines will lead to immediate disqualification.
  13. Judges' decision will be final.
  14. Organizers reserve the right to make decisions in case of conflicts and other issues.
eventFormat:
Round 1(Prelims):

The teams will have to answer a set of questions based on digital electronics. The top 10 teams will advance to the net round.


Round 2

Circuit realization

The shortlisted teams will be given a circuit which they will have to realize using logic gates. first 8 teams to realize the circuit advance to the next round.


Round 3

Debugging and design

The shortlisted teams will have to debug/design the given digital circuit to get the required output. Top 4 teams will advance to the next round.


Round 4:

Defuse

The teams will have to defuse a live time bomb by analyzing the circuit before the time runs out. The prize will be based on a viva voce if no one defuses the bomb in time.

name: 4x120
shortDes: 4 people and 120 seconds of synchronous understanding and unrivalled teamwork separate the winners from the others.
description: 4 people and 120 seconds of synchronous understanding and unrivalled teamwork separate the winners from the others. The best teams that we have encountered have a few things in common :teamwork, impeccable sync, immeasurable confidence in each other and the ability to pick up from where his predecessor left, better his effort and win the title
rules:
• Each team should have exactly four members.
  • It is not mandatory that the team members should be from the same college.
  • Participants will need to know C or C++.
  • The participants of a team will not be allowed to communicate with one another once the time begins.
  • Use of mobile phones will not be allowed during the event.
  • The team that codes the most optimal solution in the shortest time will be declared as winners.
  • Programs with least complexity would be given preference.
  • Rules are subject to change at any point in time. All rules will be explained at the event.
  • Decision of the judges will be final.
eventFormat:
Preliminary Round

MCQ round of 30 questions for 30 minutes. Top 8 teams will be Shortlisting to the final round. Correct answer will get 2 marks each. Wrong answers will have a negative mark of 1 marks.


Final Round

Finalroundcomprisesof3questions. The team members must decide which order they wishto follow before the final round question has been provided, and will not be allowed to change this order.

The question will be provided to each member only at the start of their own time slot. Once the question has been provided, each member can code for 5 mins initially, then the time slots vary to 10mins, 5mins and 10mins again. After one person’s time slot is complete the next person of the team is expected to continue coding from where his teammate had left off.

Duration for the final round is 120 minutes in total.

The teams that gets the desired output in the shortest time stand a chance to win the prize money.

shortDes: Knowledge is power, but enthusiasm pulls the switch” From untangling earphone wires to solving complicated wiring circuits, do you think you have a natural flair in wiring up electrical circuits?
name: Lumiere
description: “Knowledge is power, but enthusiasm pulls the switch” From untangling earphone wires to solving complicated wiring circuits, do you think you have a natural flair in wiring up electrical circuits? If so
lumiere is the right platform for you. Enlighten the world with the sparks of your wiring knowledge. Unleash the wiring wizard in you, before you lose track of time!
rules:
1. It is a Team event with 3 members per team.
  2. Cross college teams are allowed.
  3. All participants must have an EXCEL ID. Separate registration is not required for this event.
  4. The event comprises of 4 rounds.
  5. Excel team reserves the right to take final decisions in case of any dispute.
  6. Contestants should present their college ID cards.
  7. Cross-college teams are allowed.
  8. Malpractices and sabotaging other teams' machines will lead to immediate disqualification.
  9. Judges' decision will be final.
  10. Organizers reserve the right to make decisions in case of conflicts and other issues.
eventFormat:
Round 1 (Prelims):

The participants will have to answer a set of questions based on electrical engineering concepts. Top 8 teams will advance to the next round.


Round 2

The Big Picture

The shortlisted teams will be given a set of pictures/clues using which they have to deduce the answer related to the pictures.

Top 6 teams will advance to the next round.


Round 3

Design

The shortlisted teams will have to design an electrical wiring diagram from the given problem. The first 4 teams to design the circuit will advance to the next round.


Round 4:

Wiring

The teams will have to wire the circuit designed by them in the previous round. The team that wires the correct circuit first will be declared the winner.

name: Elecquest
shortDes: Are you game for an evening of brainstorming? If yes then brace yourselves as you embark on a journey through a sea of clues and puzzles in the quest for ultimate knowledge and power.
description: Are you game for an evening of brainstorming? If yes then brace yourselves as you embark on a journey through a sea of clues and puzzles in the quest for ultimate knowledge and power. Try hard to hit the jackpot for glory awaits!
rules:
1. A team of 3 is required.
  2. The decision of the organizers will be final.
  3. Rules are subject to change at any point of time.Participants will be duly notified of any change.
  4. Cross college teams are allowed.
  5. Contestants should present their college ID cards.
  6. Any team not abiding by the rules of the event will be immediately disqualified.
  7. Cross-college teams are allowed.
  8. a basic knowledge on proteus and arduino will be an advantage.
  9. Judges' decision will be final.
  10. Organizers reserve the right to make decisions in case of conflicts and other issues.
eventFormat:
Round 1 (Prelims):

The participants will have to face a set of questions based on electrical and electronics concepts. Top 7 teams will advance to the next round.

Round 2

Analysis

The shortlisted teams will have to analyse and correct the given circuit diagram. First 6 teams to correctly analyse the given circuit will advance to the next round.


Round 3

Signal Synthesis

The shortlisted teams will be given a continuous function to be synthesized on proteus. The first 4 teams to complete the task will advance to the next round.


Round 4

The Quest

The teams shortlisted will have to collect clues that are spread all over the campus and have to complete the final task based on the clues collected. The first team to complete the task will be declared the winner.

name: Algorithms
shortDes: Get ready to show off your coding skills and you’re in depth knowledge of Algorithms at ‘Algorithms’.
description: Get ready to show off your coding skills and you’re in depth knowledge of Algorithms at ‘Algorithms’. Defying the usual norms, this event will challenge you, surprise you and test you till you break or fight back! Get –Set- code!
rules:
• Participants can code in C, C++, Java or Python.
  • Use of mobile phones will not be allowed during the event.
  • The individual that codes the most optimal solution in the shortest time will be declared as the winner (Highest points).
  • Programs with least complexity will be given preference.
  • The decision of the judges will be final and rules are subject to change at any point of time.
eventFormat:
Preliminary Round

  • This is an individual event.
  • General Tech based MCQ Questions to be solved in 30mins.
  • The top few contestants move on to the final stage.



Final Round

  • Consists of a pure coding competition with a 2 hour time limit.
  • The person with the highest score will be the winner, in cases of a tie of points, complexity of the programs will be considered.

name: Lord of Code
shortDes: It takes grit, expertise, and mastery to crack the most twisted of codes and complex of logics. Do you have what it takes to win the title, the ‘Lord of the Code’? Bring it on!
description:
If you control the code, you control the world!

It takes grit, expertise, and mastery to crack the most twisted of codes and complex of logics. Do you have what it takes to win the title, the ‘Lord of the Code’? Bring it on!
rules:
• Each team can have a maximum of two members. Cross - college teams are allowed.
  • Decision of the judges and organizers will be final.
  • Final round participants can use C, C++, Java or Python for coding.
  • Logical questions focus more on better logic and less on completion time.
  • Coding focuses equally on the completion time and the logic.
  • Rules are subject to change at any point in time. All rules will be explained at the event.
eventFormat:
Preliminary Round

MCQ round of 30 questions for 30 minutes. Top 8 teams will be Shortlisting to the final round. Correct answer will get 2 marks each. Wrong answers will have a negative mark of 1 marks.



Final Round

Two rounds running parallel, half of the team will solve the logical questions, other one will solve the coding question. Exactly after 60 minutes, the roles will be switched, and the winner is the team who scores the maximum points. There will be 5 logical questions and 2 coding questions, marks will be provided on the basis of logic and completion. The maximum marks for each of the logic question is 5, maximum marks for each of the coding question is 25.

name: Gradle-Build
shortDes: As the world today finds itself revolving around apps, do you possess the skills to make apps revolve around you?
description: As the world today finds itself revolving around apps, do you possess the skills to make apps revolve around you? Bring out the genius in you and prove how skilled you are when it comes to App Development.
rules:
• As the world today finds itself revolving around apps, do you possess the skills to make apps revolve around you? Bring out the genius in you and prove how skilled you are when it comes to App Development.A team can have a maximum of 3 members.
  • Students from any engineering branch can participate.
  • The students can use internet for reference but code snippets cannot be copied from websites.
  • Systems and devices will not be provided. Candidates should bring their own laptops and devices.
  • Judges decision will be final.
  • Rules are subject to change at any point in time. All rules will be explained at the event as well.
  • Organizers reserve the right to take decisions in case of conflicts and issues.
eventFormat:
Preliminary Round

Use your basic knowledge of programming and debugging in Android Studio to get through the preliminary round.



Final Round

Teams must replicate the App provided in both functionality and UI. Apps will be judged based on the progress made at the end of the competition

name: Lifeline
description: Get your act

together before the patient flat-lines. Scrutinise the inner workings of an impaired medical instrument to keep a soul alive. An exclusive event which provides an opportunity to assert your proficiency in debugging and endow yourself with the honour of being a life saver.
shortDes: Get your act
together before the patient flat-lines. Scrutinise the inner workings of an impaired medical instrument to keep a soul alive.
rules:
1. The competition is held for teams of 2 members.
  2. Cross-college teams are allowed.
  3. Failing to save the patient in given time results in immediate elimination.
  4. The coordinators of the event reserve the right to take appropriate decisions in case of any issues/conflicts.
  5. Rules are subject to change at any point in time. All rules will be explained at the event as well.
  6. The decision of the judges would be final and binding.
  7. Base knowledge in proteus simulation will be an advantage.
  8. Malpractices and sabotaging other teams' machines will lead to immediate disqualification.
eventFormat:
Round 1(Prelims):

The Teams will have to face a set of questions based on electronics and biomedical engineering concepts. Top 8 teams will advance to the next round.


Round 2

Bio-signal Synthesis

The shortlisted teams will have to synthesize the given set of bio signals. top 4 teams will advance to the next round.


Round 3

The life saver

Saving a life is the only thing that matters now. Design and debug circuits to make sure the patient survives.

The team to design/debug the given circuit will be declared the winner.

shortDes:
Take risks and expect the unexpected cause it's all about amateurism.

Dalal Bull is an online stock marketing event. It is the ultimate stock exchange event and it tests the individuals trading skills.
name: DalalBull
description:
Fortune favors the brave.

Take risks and expect the unexpected cause it's all about amateurism.

Dalal Bull is an online stock marketing event. It is the ultimate stock exchange event and it tests the individuals trading skills. Each participant will be provided with a fixed amount as initial capital. This amount can be used to buy shares of different NIFTY50 firms. Actual market fluctuations decides the share price. This game is reality and when stock value rise, you rise with it.
rules: The rules of this event can be found at play.excelmec.org
eventFormat: The event format can be found at play.excelmec.org
